trans:
Fear is a reaction to a threat you perceive as dangerous and can cause mental as well as physical reactions. It becomes a problem when these feelings persist and hinder your daily functioning.
How do you deal with panic and anxiety?
Acknowledging panic and fear as common reactions to stress is crucial. Identifying the causes and symptoms is an important first step to management. Techniques as breathing exercises, mindfulness and cognitive behaviour therapy can be effective when dealing with these feelings.
Help with panic and anxiety
Regularly experiencing panic or feelings of anxiety can be a sign of the need for professional support. A psychologist can help you understand the roots of your fear and develop strategies to deal with these feelings. At our practice we offer specialised help to support you in finding the inner peace and regaining controle over your emotions.
